structure.unit: Jurisdiction And Emblems Of The Commonwealth, The General Court, Statutes And Public Documents

law.catch_line: Requests And Recommendations For Appropriations And Capital Outlay Programs Or Projects; Public Hearings; Notice
law.text: [ Text of section effective until January 1, 2013. For text effective January 1, 2013, see below.] The committee on ways and means of each branch of the general court, or the joint committee on ways and means, shall conduct public hearings on all requests and recommendations for appropriations for the executive, judicial and legislative branches of the state government and on all requests and recommendations for capital outlay programs and projects which the governor submits to the general court; provided, however, that in the case of requests and recommendations for appropriations submitted pursuant to section two of Article LXIII of the Amendments to the Constitution and in the case of requests and recommendations for capital outlay programs and projects said committee shall give five days public notice prior to holding such public hearings. Chapter 3: Requests and recommendations for appropriations and capital outlay programs or projects; public hearings; notice [ Text of section as amended by 2012, 165, Sec. 6 effective January 1, 2013. See 2012, 165, Sec. 137. For text effective until January 1, 2013, see above.] The committee on ways and means of each branch of the general court shall conduct public hearings on all requests and recommendations for appropriations for the executive, judicial and legislative branches of the state government submitted under section 2 of Article LXIII of the Amendments to the Constitution. The house and senate committees on bonding, capital expenditures and state assets, or a committee of the general court having primary jurisdiction over requests and recommendations for capital outlay programs and projects which the governor submits to the general court, shall hold a hearing on such requests and recommendations. Any committee referred to in this section shall give 5 days public notice prior to holding such public hearings.
